Reviews.Title: “#1 Bug Hotel. Do not be fooled. Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Cagudelo24
Reviews.Content: GROUPON- This is by far the worse experience I have ever had! This place takes "roach motel" to the next level! I checked in and inspected the bed. I found a spider on the bed! I called front desk to request the sheets be changed. Instead they change me to another room. I went to the registration desk and the girl asked me to wait while she had someone check the cleanliness of this new room. It was not clean so she puts me in Another room. There were no "clean" rooms with a king bed so i got 2 queen beds. At a glance it seemed clean. I went to dinner. When. I came back I was ready to go to sleep. I inspected the 1st bed and it had an ant, so I figured, "ok I will sleep in the other bed". On the 2nd bed I find 2 bugs that were not ants! I called the front desk requesting to just be checked out. The employee tries to tell me that she had inspected the room and that those were "just sugar ants". #1 I know sugar ants! I was born and raised in Miami and I know what they look like. #2. What if they were sugar ants, WHY IS IT OK THAT THEY ARE ON MY BED?? She insisted she inspected the room so we went to inspect room together. The same bugs were on the bed and they were bouncing! fleas perhaps? She was not Authorized to refund me the taxes I paid. How crazy is that??? There wasn't even a manager on duty that I can speak to about my situation! The manager called me after I left while I was on a hunt for another hotel to stay at that night. By this time it was 11p! I just wanted a bed!! The manager continued to attempt to justify that the bugs were "just sugar ants". Was I supposed to be ok with sugar ants on the bed I sleep on? I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO ANYONE! I will be calling Groupon to get my money back!

Reviews.Title: “Not what you'd expect”
Reviews.Author: gamblingal476
Reviews.Content: First the good things: Maurice, the maintenance worker, is awsome. He has an impossible task to do, but does whatever he can quickly and with a smile. The hotel is in a prime location, close to attractions and shopping. That's kind of where the good stuff ends. If you go there expecting to do some of your own cleaning, you'll be much happier! We were sent to this hotel from our original choice, telling us that there was a "water break"...good excuse for overbooking. It took an inordinant amount of time to check in with lots of confusion, despite that 3 people were working the desk. Room had no refrigerator or microwave. Coffee pot still had coffee and grounds from the previous customer. Ice bucket had standing water in it. Air conditioning didn't work until maintenance person fixed it. Hornets were building several nests outside our sliding door. There were no chairs outside the sliding door on which to sit and enjoy the Florida sun. The security bar on the sliding door was too short to do its job. No secure key entry to the building. Only 2 hangers in the closet. Lipstick kiss on the mirrored closet door. Grounds unkempt, with dead branches and trash here and there. Bedding was only a sheet and a light blanket. Blanket was dirty/stained. Carpet stained. Breakfast less than what you'd expect at a nice hotel. Scrambled eggs, juice and 1 toaster that was in use most of the time. Cafe not open at lunch time. This resort could be spectacular! It's well-designed and in a beautiful location, tucked back away from the highway. It's too bad the ownership has chosen not to invest in better upkeep and maintenance. One last thing...the staff seems to be working hard to make the best of their situation. Although the housekeeping staff could use some training or standards, they were friendly and willing to try to accommodate our requests. In all, it was disappointing and in sharp contrast to another hotel we stayed in at the end of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experinece EVER”
Reviews.Author: CDO925
Reviews.Content: The Orlando Sun's website is complete FALSE advertising. The only thing hey have as advertised is a pool. Rooms not as clean as they should be and the grounds are very shabby. There was old furniture and trash in some of the breezeways and housekeeping did not come daily and we had to go to the office to get our own clean towels. Will NEVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: juliespreng
Reviews.Content: We were booked at another hotel and got moved to this one. WE had no hot water. We asked front desk for more towels they wouldnt give us any. No WI FI. Breakfast a joke eggs were runny. No waffles. A maintence guy had to tell us the room they put us in was not done unusable. So he had to go get us another room.. Rooms didnt have fridge or microwave. They say heated pool yea you had to go around the hotel ...to another wing to get to the heated pool . Bugs in the room trash left in the room.. ONLY GOOD THING IS THE BARTENDER TIM. HE WAS VERY HELPFUL AND FRIENDLY ....BOTTLED BEER ONLY 3 DOLLARS. ADVISE IF YOU GO HERE GO TO BAR BEFORE YOU GET IN LINE TO CHECK IN IT TAKES AT A MINIMUM 1 AND HALF TO GET CHECKED IN..

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable!”
Reviews.Author: Teri Suzanne M
Reviews.Content: This was the the hotel from hell. Room was filthy. Never cleaned but once in 3 days and then only half done. WiFi didn't work, pools closed, ice machine didn't work, halls inside and out were filthy! This place made Motel 6 look like a palace! Front desk and management were very unsympathetic and offered little help. Never was able to talk to General Manage after repeated phone calls. To cap it off received an obscene phone call in the middle of the night and the names that were given just happened to be the names of 2 of their male employees! BUT they said they had no way of knowing where the call came from...Don't go there unless you like dirty rooms, no towels, hand towels or face cloths,or soap replaced or coffee or clean coffee cups and glasses, etc., etc., etc. I would rate this place lower than a -1........I developed a urinary tract infection on the day after left there. Picked up some bacteria somewhere, the dirty toilet maybe???

Reviews.Title: “Not what I was expecting. (groupon)”
Reviews.Author: kris l
Reviews.Content: I thought that I was getting a really great deal when I bought the 3 night stay groupon for 155. (which is supposed to be about 50% off) However, this place did not meet my expectations. When we first arrived, we noticed that there were about 3 other cars there. I was hoping for a resort to actually have business. I didn't mind as I figured everything else would be really great. Check in wasn't that bad, except for the fact that when I read the Q&A on groupon about the total fees, the person responding did not say there were resort fees. Oh well, no worries, but the check in lady that i had made the reservation with told me that it would be $51. Well it was $66. again, I'm thinking oh well this is a steal of a deal anyways. I was the only person getting checked in and the staff seemed friendly enough, but distracted. Also, I felt that they could have been more appropriately dressed. While driving to room I notice the ghost town and wonder if this place has an awful reputation or what. The steps to go upstairs definitely need some work done, then we went up and there was a lot of sitting water that seemed hazardous. Also, I think that in order to be able to get into the pod thing where your room is you should have to use your room key. I guess its just me, but I feel safer that way. The room was clean and met our needs. However, they did not have any sort of booklet or binder that describes amenities, room service, nearby attractions, food, or anything. I guess thats just a perk that I like. Also, they did not have any sort of channel guide for the TV. The "on demand" movies described in amenities on the website is NOT TRUE. again, oh well. I did not have a "do not disturb" door hanger either. That would have been nice so I wouldn't have been woken up by housekeeping, although the lady seemed friendly enough. Oh one thing about housekeeping is that I'm not sure if it was them or just the guests, but there were piles of towels in the hallways, I don't know, it was weird to me. we had to travel to different pods to find ice as the icemachine wasn't working in 2 places that we tried. :/ THE BEDS: are nice and pillows are mostly soft, one of them had some really hard spots that were uncomfortable. They only have sheets and then a small blanket folded at the bottom, no comforters. I personally get cold very easily and didnt mind their method of doing this, but would have appreciated an extra blanket in the closet or something. There were supposed to be several pools, but the staff said that basically only 1 was working. we didnt visit them, but i heard a disgruntled customer complain about it not being heated or even ready when i was checking out. There is internet, but it is a very poor connection, our phones could only briefly connect. We were glad we brought a computer which connected better. Overall, we made our trip a good time, so the little things about this hotel didn't offend us horribly. However, I do not understand what the resort fees are for, the pools are not working, there is practically no activity, etc. I also do not understand why there is a surcharge for a microwave and/or minifridge. We didn't have either, but it would have been nice. I have spent less on a hotel than what this resort wants to charge, and yet the hotel had both of those included, not to mention comforters, pools, etc. I would stay at this 'resort' again, if renovations were really made and some changes were made. This is a great location, however I have spent less money and had extremely better value.

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: MaleNurse2012
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the pictures this place does not deserve any rating stars. The location is good, but everything else is BAD.. Bugs in there rooms, the rooms smell, poor service, the place was a ghost town. The ice machines where all rusted out and not working. The staff are trained to apologize about everything and do nothing. Beware of this place.. Staff are writing up reviews to make it seem better.. STAY AWAY

Reviews.Title: “Not even the Groupon made this hotel worth it”
Reviews.Author: lsimon8487
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that the only good thing about this hotel was the location. Given that we were in Orlando to visit the Universal Studios theme park, it's proximity to the I-4 expressway made it ideal. The positives, however, end there. We booked a 3-night stay at the Orlando Sun Resort because Groupon offered what we thought was a great deal...we were wrong. We ended up checking out a day early and in retrospect, the $155 (about half off the normal rate) was way too much for what we got. From the get go, our experience was a sour one; it took over 30 minutes to check in, and there were only two other groups in front of us. And the entire duration of our stay, we only ever saw one person working at the front desk. Once we finally did manage to check in, we were directed to one of the rooms located towards the side of the resort. On the short drive there, we couldn't help but notice that this place was a virtual ghost town, with no more than a handful of cars parked throughout. As for the room, well where do I start? There was a musty smell throughout the hallways and in the room itself. I would also love to know exactly what renovations were done to the hotel because they certainly weren't done to the rooms (or the lobby, or any other location that was visible to us). On our first night there, we had to switch rooms because the hot water wasn't working in the shower (it was working in the sink though...go figure). They told us to let the water run from both the sink and shower for 15-20 minutes to see if that worked, and it was only when the maintenance guy came and tried the same thing (along with flushing the toilet) that they decided to move us. Even then, the water pressure was horrible and the toilet didn't work properly. I don't know if if it was the musty smell, the chlorine-like cleaner they used for the towels and sheets, the pet-friendly rooms, or a combination of all three that gave my boyfriend horrible allergies that kept us in on the first night there (even though we would have much rather gone out, as far away from the room as possible). And to top it off, housekeeping was a virtual no-show, entering the room while we were at the park only to drop off some towels on the bathroom sink and not even bothering to empty the trash. Stay far, far away from this place. Whatever renovations they recently underwent were most certainly not applied to the areas of the hotel that needed it most. We couldn't bare to stay there another night and we most definitely won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “No Blanket Provided among many other thing!”
Reviews.Author: Shawna S
Reviews.Content: Was astounded that they charged an extra cleaning fee and the rooms weren’t even clean. We had to chase them down for towels three of the four days we were there and they didn’t provide hand towel or wash clothes unless asked. Their idea of bedding is a sheet then extra light blanket and another sheet on top. The green blanket on the bottom of the bed is a throw. They did have a plus of the beds and pillows being comfortable. The pool had a health warning sign on the pool and was not usable. The halls were musty and the grounds were poorly maintained. We heard ambulances and police several times though the night. The continental breakfast was a joke but you could tell the cook was doing the best he could with what he was given. The place is way too big and it seems they can’t maintain the property and fill the rooms. They were tarring the parking lot when I was there but was disappointed to see that’s how they would spend the money instead of the rooms. The only spot that I saw remodeled was the lobby’s restrooms. Also, they should offer rooms that are pet free rooms so customers with allergies would not be miserable

Reviews.Title: “Don't Even Bother!”
Reviews.Author: Robertandsuzie
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin?? Check in took 45 minutes, WITH NO LINE! The continental breakfast is not worth the time it takes to walk down to the lobby. The room was not cleaned properly, only bed made and trash taken out. The hot water was intermittent and the ice machine didn't work. The walls are so thin you can hear the people in the next room loud and clear. The hotel has a weird smell and there were various repairs needed. It's the first time my wife and I left a hotel early and just ate the cost of another night. We had to get out!

Reviews.Title: “No electricity & no water. Groupon beware”
Reviews.Author: Cucu28
Reviews.Content: We bought Our 4 night stay with groupon. Big mistake. They misrepresented this place so much. Million dollar renovations???? Where???? Pools???? Where?????? This place should be knocked down and destroyed. We arrived at around 8pm and we couldn't see the place. There were absolutely no light on nothing. The place had no power. It was pitch black and we were scared to even exit our car. I saw a Spanish male walking and asked if this place is open and he said yes but we have no electricity. Okkkkkaaayyyyy. I walked in to find the front desk was powered by a lamp with no cover on plugged to an extension cord that ran over the counter and to a generator. Ghettooooo. There were three little kids running around screaming and yelling " the managers kids I might add" and of course the staff was dressed as if I was at a local flea market and spoke very bad English. I felt like I was in Mexico. Then the great news came, we have no power or water pressure.... Meaning no water. Then I asked what about the pools mentioned on groupon and they told me they are under constriction. Really I answered and then rudely was asked do you want to check inn or not. Because if I check you inn you will be charged and there is also a 18% service fee and $11 a day per person resort fee. I walked out that moment because the owner said to us that the part required to restore power and water would boot arrive for another couple of days. This place should not be advertising on groupon or on any web site as being anything but horrific and disqusting. I would never return here or refer anyone to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Beware! Especially unsuspecting Groupon'ers”
Reviews.Author: ekrakauer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my girlfriend for a romantic, Disney getaway. Travelocity rated the hotel three stars, and this "resort" should be lucky to receive a one star rating. The place was completely run down. I understand that the hotel underwent a recent renovation. The only way a renovation would even make a dent in this place was if it was completely torn down in the past six months and was rebuilt from the ground up. There was mold everywhere. The mattress was from the 70's. Every morning, we woke up with back pain after a terrible night's sleep- and we are in our early 20's! On top of it, we were advised there would be free transportation to Disney.Upon checking in, we were informed there was no such amenity. The entire lobby was leaking after any sort of rainfall. The place was a ghost town- we may have been the only ones staying in our entire block. The door knobs were falling off, wallpaper peeling, it was AWFUL! Oh, and the lovely ten dollar-a-day resort fee to boot made it so much better. I would never stay here regardless of the amount of renovations made to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Everything but a Resort.”
Reviews.Author: Jessica S
Reviews.Content: This place was a joke. We HAD to stay here because the hotel we originally booked (Ramada at Jamaican Court, Orlando) overbooked us. We got there and it was hard to find, the lighting was horrible. At first glance inside the lobby, I thought it was nice. It was just a nice facade. It took us forever to get checked in and then they charged me a resort fee of $50 which I thought was ridiculous because we didn't even want to stay there in the first place. We finally got checked in and had to drive in circles around a dark parking lot to find our building. The property looked like a run down apartment complex. We got in our room to find that the bed did not even have comforters on it, there were 3 sheets on each bed. Then it was a walk in shower so I could not even give my son a bath. It reeked of an old sweaty locker room. The walls were paper thin and could hear everything the other guests were saying. Over all this place is definitely no resort and should consider changing its name. What a joke! i will not recommend this place to anyone! Also, it seems that the only reason people stay here is because other hotels overbook. I was standing there in the lobby with 2 other families and both of them said that they were at the Orlando Sun Resort because their original hotel overbooked them.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure how to rate this place”
Reviews.Author: RCDS_Family
Reviews.Content: We were booked at another hotel for 2 nights in 2 rooms on Dec 31 and Jan 1 but the other hotel was overbooked and we were sent to this "Resort" instead. The property location was great. It was close to highway access and there were plenty of shops and restaurants. Check in was very slow and must have taken 15 minutes. We were given 2 connecting rooms in a nearby block. The resort is set up in 2 story buildings with approx 12 rooms on each of the 2 stories. The property is poorly lit at night with many of the exterior bulbs burnt out. With the lighting issue it actually seemed unsafe at times. In addition we hardly saw anyone else or other vehicles during our stay except at breakfast. The rooms were old and dated but somewhat clean. The rooms must of not have been used in a while. When we turned on the water in both rooms, brown water came out until we let the water run for a while. Pillow in the room must of been washed quite a number of times as there were hared dried clumps inside every single pillow we had. We could not find an ice machine that worked in our block or 2 nearby buildings. Breakfast the next morning was not much to talk about. They had scrambled eggs and some cold options. But as a free breakfast it was acceptable. Overall there were some positive aspects of this property and it does have potential. Our feeling is that it was a nice resort at some time in the past but now it is old and a struggle to maintain.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the road”
Reviews.Author: Maria P
Reviews.Content: The first piece of advice is DO book through a third party (IE Hotels.com or expedia). Because they couldn't access our account we didn't get double charged for their $11 per day resort fee. Secondly don't expect the discount disney tickets that are offered on their website they don't have any. They do have the shuttle service offered but you don't get picked up until 10:30 AM and they pick you up before the parks close. If you're looking for a clean hotel with friendly and helpful house-keeping and a decent free breakfast then this is the right hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel is not worth it”
Reviews.Author: david m
Reviews.Content: Well this hotel is not worth what they say you should be paying for . The only nice thing about this hotel is the lobby and that´s only if you hide the leaking roof smelly bathrooms and dirty floors and old plants that are in need of water . but when you get to the front desk agents they smile just to hide the real truth of the hotel . I just did a walk inn to this hotel and they wanted to charge me a rate I will only pay at a Holiday Inn or Quality hotel the only reason I say this is because once you check in your running back to the front desk to check out the hotels room are infested with dead bugs behind the counters dead bugs in the corner of the bathroom and the night table looks like it hasn't been dusted since they brought it the phone books are full of dust the air-conditioner are filled with mildew and spots of molds fungi and if you closely at some of the walls you will the fungi growing out of it and the windows good luck trying to get the sliding doors open they feel like they haven´t been checked in ages well the hotel was horrible witch ever way you put it I will never visit this hotel not even if they offer me a free room night week or year agreement.

Reviews.Title: ““Just what we expected””
Reviews.Author: Manish C
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, well-priced and conveniently close to I 4. We stayed here on our way to Disney and Miami, FL. Ideal location for Disney, SeaWorld, not too far from Universal. The staff was very friendly accommodating. Feel so lucky that we ended up here! The hotel was clean, rooms were very spacious and clean. We would actually stay here again Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding”
Reviews.Author: donna b
Reviews.Content: We held our wedding at the orlando sun resort on 10/30/11 we picked the resort dew to the amout of family and friends coming into town. the staff was very helpful. the paridise hall that we had our wedding in was nice, we had 15 rooms would like to see flat screen tv's but other than that was a very nice time.

Reviews.Title: “Orlando Sun Resort should be your LAST resort!”
Reviews.Author: Melinjax
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed 6/24/11-6/26/11 to attend a convention being held there. The entire experience was horrible. The first room they gave us was in a building that smelled like a dirty toilet and our room was swarming with gnats. We requested, and were given, a new room in a different building. In this room we were provided with ONE wash cloth and ONE piece of soap the size of a .50 piece for the two of us to share. When we requested more wash cloths, we were informed the hotel does not do laundry on the weekend and there were no more towels. Yes, I am serious. Also, the carpet in the room was so dirty it turned my white socks black. Housekeeping never made our room up during our stay. My friend and I will never, ever stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again if things improve”
Reviews.Author: WoleAdeleye
Reviews.Content: I made reservation as Ramada celebration only to discover a change of name to Orlando Sun Resort which is still not popular in town. This gave some challengies as regards taxi transportation. The hotel with about 800rooms on large acreage of land presented a walking distance to get across to the lobby.The capacity utilisation was low during our visit and hence look like a ghost town in the lobby,reception and restaurant areas which not too good for tourists who want to see activities

Reviews.Title: “2011 State Latin Forum Conference”
Reviews.Author: Magister71
Reviews.Content: Although the staff was very friendly and very willing to assist, there simply was not enough staffing to ensure that everything was covered. The fact that rooms were not cleaned and that new towels were not distributed over the 2 night stay was inexcusable. There were significant issues with temperature control. Air conditioning did not function well (or at all) in the various conference areas. The food provided by the hotel was adequate, but the staffing of the various "shops" within the conference center was not. I do not believe that the main hotel restaurant was open during the time we were there. Overall, the cleanliness of the facilities was an issue, and there was a shabbiness and disrepair to the entire property that made it seem as if the hotel was soon to close.

Reviews.Title: “It was mostly alright”
Reviews.Author: cpd02c
Reviews.Content: Cleanliness, there was garbage strewn throughout the property and the rooms needed a fresh coat of paint. I am concerned about the abandoned "pod" at the far end of the property as each year it is in more disrepair.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for - 2”
Reviews.Author: Gopherhill
Reviews.Content: I was there for a conference. I have been to this hotel a number of times over 25 years. It just isn't being maintained. In my room one light bulb was out, the TV remote didn't work right, and the WiFi was unreliable. The grounds were full of weeds and dead plants. Very limited staff, but mostly friendly and helpful. Food was marginal, breakfast included powdered eggs. Sheets didn't quite cover the king size bed. Free coffee service in the lobby with a roach (the bug, not the kind you smoke) on the table.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is old, Service is Impeccable”
Reviews.Author: Biniafer
Reviews.Content: Orlando Sun's location is good, service was outstanding. Its a old hotel, rooms need to be brought up.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing works!”
Reviews.Author: elaine555
Reviews.Content: Would not stay there ever again. Got in the room, no remote control, took 3 hours to get one. TV unstable on the stand couldnt turn it to see from chair. No ice in the ice machine in the building. No water in the pool or jaccuzzi. Weeds and trash all over. Iron didnt work, took one hour to get another one. No regular coffee, they were out then coffee maker didnt work after we got our own coffee. Trees growing on balcony. Weeds and trash all over the ground. No washcloths. Internet wasnt always available. Bed was comfortable. $11.00 for resort fees...but nothing works! I travel 6-7 times a year and this is the first time I write a negative comment. This was the worst place. If we had not gotten there so late the first night..we wouldnt have stay the second one.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely poor management and guest relations”
Reviews.Author: vacationtraveler1234
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this Orlando Sun Resort & Convention Center 6375 W. Irlo Bronson Memorial Hwy., Kissimmee, FL, 34747. During separate stays. April, & May,2011. Lousy desk service, Do not fix problems, I had to argue for breakfast which I was promised by CheapOStay. Did not receive the room promised upon arrival. Major parking problems. Noisy guests, graduation party and a second day of costume convention. They took all the guest parking.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY FROM THIS PROPERTY!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MikeOxlong26045
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my Wife and Kids over Spring Break 2011, and booked thru Southwest.Com, and was listed as Ramada, after getting there found out it wasn't. Stayed anyway and wished we hadn't. Motel was unkempt, and in terrible repai, as if bought recently out of forclosure. Never got was cloths in 2+ days, room, and motel smelld of mildew, obvious mold infusion. 3 of the 4 of us had to see a doctor after getting home and was told we had developed sinus infections. Management of the establishment, nor Southwest chose to compensate us in any way at all. And to beat all they charge a $10 resort fee for an unkept pool and tennis courts with no nets, and leaves piled 5 feet high, what a scam!!! GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!! YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!!!

Reviews.Title: “we were very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: biker508
Reviews.Content: had to ask for towels a couple of times; pool was dirty; no shuttle service to parks like we were told had to rent a car and pay for parking at the parks;reserved a king bed got a room with two double beds

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is Horrid; Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: sparklynails
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay here but saw the rooms that friends were staying in for an Academic competition. This place is awful, really. It's not fit for habitation. I hate to say it, because the staff was super nice, especially the desk attendant. Weeds are growing everywhere. Rooms are scary. Some buildings appear to be abandoned. There is no rate low enough to lure you to this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: mixsonanderson
Reviews.Content: Great place. I read all the reviews and was a little nervious. When we checked in we met Ruben at the front desk was great. The rooms are large and very clean. Also we had three towels :)

Reviews.Title: “Didn't care about my problem”
Reviews.Author: sherryayala
Reviews.Content: I Called this hotel 3 hrs after I got home, tellng them I left my $75 make-up mirror in room, spoke several times with so called "Security" and "Management. They claimed housekeeping didn't find it, well someone did because it was not in my suitcase when I returned home. Keep being told they were "looking into it", well that never happened. My daughter is a travel agent & she has told everyone she knows, going to Orlando/Kissimmee area, NOT to go to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect combination of Amenities, Location, and Hospitality...”
Reviews.Author: elvissloan
Reviews.Content: I really liked the accommodations...The room and all the amenities were so very nice and the hospitality of Mayra Ramos, Joseph Nazareth, and the staff went far beyond my expectations...The location is also so close to everything that you are only minutes away from anything that you or you and your family could possible desire to do...I will very happily recommend the Orlando Sun Resort to any and all that I come in contact with that needs an excellent place to stay for their vacation or stay for long term...Mayra, Joseph, and all the staff members were so very friendly and they took that extra step to make sure that my stay at the Orlando Sun Resort was a very enjoyable and relaxing experience... Sincerely, Kenneth A. Sloan

Reviews.Title: “Needs upgrading and much fixing up!”
Reviews.Author: CanAm85
Reviews.Content: Many rooms, not many visitors, given a room right by the highway ramp, extremely noisy night, sparse room, no facecloths or hand towels, grounds weedy and in need of much landscaping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Foomanj
Reviews.Content: I checked into the hotel with my family and there was a line to check-in. I was upset at first but was greeted with a smile and a choice of water or soda for all us. They realized there was a wait but were doing a great job to make everyone feel welcomed. With such a large beautiful lobby there were plenty of places for us to sit but we decided to take the kids outside to run around. We had breakfast the next day and I don't think I saw one of their staff members without a smile and wow there is a lot of food on that buffet and very good. They didn't even mind us taking some bagles for later.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent find”
Reviews.Author: leo_rose
Reviews.Content: The hotel was busy, there was a long line at front desk, but they accomodated us at the lounge until we got the room. The breakfast was a treat. The carpet had a spot near the bathroom. But overall clean.

Reviews.Title: “Had to find another place to stay”
Reviews.Author: whobdis
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the 'resort' at 5:30 only to be told rooms weren't available YET. Still cleaning. Arrived at 8 and was told the same thing. We went to the Boardwalk..came back around 11 PM and a rather angry group of maybe 30 people were being told the same thing. How LONG can it take to clean rooms? Fortunately we had friend in Orlando and stayed there. I felt terrible for the people with kids. When I asked for a refund they claimed I was a 'no show'..that I should have waited. I said 'when did you get everyone in'. He said 'we had everyone in a room by midnight'. MIDNIGHT!! I'm supposed to wait with kids until Midnight!

HotelInfo.Name: Orlando Sun Resort Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 6375 W Irlo Bronson Memorial Hwy, Kissimmee, FL 34747
